intro: Clutia abyssinica var. abyssinica, commonly known as Abyssinian clutia, is a shrub native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Clutia abyssinica var. abyssinica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
